alert.note: Alert for Mora; Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 8:52PM MDT until July 14 at 9:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL TAOS AND NORTHWESTERN MORA COUNTIES... At 852 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area have weakened, but rain is still ongoing. Up to 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Rio La Casa, Vigil Creek, Coyote Creek, Mora River, and La Canada del Carro. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Holman, Chacon, Cleveland, Tres Ritos, El Turquillo, Guadalupita and Luceros. This includes the following highways... State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 31 and 49. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 1 and 15. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 0 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
